meanings.definition: Exteriorises: to make external or outward
meanings.sent1: She exteriorises her feelings by smiling brightly.
meanings.sent2: The sun exteriorises its warmth on a cold day.
meanings.sent3: The magician exteriorises a rabbit from his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: His kindness exteriorises in the way he helps others without hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The artist exteriorises her creativity through vibrant paintings.

meanings.definition: Exteriorises: to manifest or reveal outwardly
meanings.sent1: The plant exteriorises its growth through blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: His excitement exteriorises in a big smile on his face.
meanings.sent3: The detective exteriorises the truth from the suspect with clever questioning.
meanings.sent4: The storm exteriorises its power with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The author exteriorises her imagination in captivating stories.
